chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Eli T. Cotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with victim except defendant may pick up son at residence which is the same as victim, and defendant to do curbside pick up of son.  NO verbal contact with victim when at residence.  

No unsupervised contact with minor females.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any other assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

90 days MCJ

State appears by ADA R.Uttke.  Def appears in person and with Atty Richard Lawson.

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Cause Child <13 to View/Listen to Sexual Act)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 (DC)>>GUILTY
Ct. 3 (DC)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty on Cts 2 and 3 only.

COURT ORDERS:
Cts. 2 and 3>>Sentence W/held on both counts; 2 years probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: (CORRECTED BY CLERK 1/17/17) NC with victim except defendant may pick up son at residence which is the same as victim, and defendant to do curbside pick up of son and no verbal contact with victim when at residence; No unsupervised contact with minor females; Any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC

Ct. 1>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1.

AMENDED No contact with victim(s): K.A.N. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. However defendant may pick up son at residence which is the same residence as K.A.N. Defendant to do curbside pick up of son & no verbal contact with K.A.N. when at residence.
